bibl.title: Letter from Daniel L. Borden to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1942

div1.p: Borden sends Hench information on Reed's appendix operation, performed by Borden's father.

div1.head: Letter from Daniel L. Borden to Philip Showalter Hench, January 27, 1942
div1.opener:
DANIEL L. BORDEN, M. D.
503 COLUMBIA MEDICAL BUILDING
1835 EYE STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
January 27, 1942.
Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
At the request of Dr. John A. Reed and Dr. Charles
Stanley White, I am enclosing information relative to Dr. Walter
Reed that may be helpful to you.

I have copied the original notes from the Medical Annals.
In the original publication there is appended, at the end of these
notes, four pictures of the appendix removed from Dr. Walter Reed.
I have not included these pictures, but I will be glad to have
copies made of them and sent to you if that will be helpful to you
in any way.

If there is anything further that I can do to help
you do not hesitate to call upon me. Our family and the Reed
family have always been very close and intimate friends and there
is still impressed on my memory Walter Reed's tragic death.
Especially do I remember my father's great sorrow at the time
when he operated upon Dr. Reed, and I remember so distinctly how
difficult it was for him to act as pallbearer after having passed
through hours of anguish.

I am sorry that I did not have the opportunity to
see you personally when you were in Washington for I would have
taken you to my mother who could have given you many interesting
details.
div1.closer:
Most sincerely yours, Daniel L. Borden, M.D. DLB/G
enc.-2.
